conclusion: There are four objects: a mushroom (A), a statue-like object (B), a dress-like object (C), and a book (D).
The shadows cast by these objects are labeled A, B, C, and D.
The light source moves forward (closer to the objects and above them).

premise: When the light source moves forward, shadows shift in the opposite direction of the light source's movement.
conclusion: If the light source moves forward, the shadows will move backward (away from the light source).

premise: The size of the shadows depends on the relative position of the light source to the objects. If the light source gets closer to the objects, the shadows will become smaller.
conclusion: If the light source moves closer to the objects, the shadows will become smaller.

conclusion: Shadow A will move backward (away from the light source) and become smaller.

conclusion: Shadow D will move backward (away from the light source) and become smaller.

conclusion: When the light source moves forward above the objects, A, B, C, and D shift backward and become shorter and smaller.
